title: Team Drives: duplicate files with copyto and --ignore-times
body:
<!--

Welcome :-) We understand you are having a problem with rclone; we want to help you with that!

If you've just got a question or aren't sure if you've found a bug then please use the rclone forum:

    https://forum.rclone.org/

instead of filing an issue for a quick response.

If you think you might have found a bug, please can you try to replicate it with the latest beta?

    https://beta.rclone.org/

If you can still replicate it with the latest beta, then please fill in the info below which makes our lives much easier.  A log with -vv will make our day :-)

Thank you

The Rclone Developers

-->

#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?

`rclone copyto --ignore-times` creates duplicate files when doing server side copies from one team drive to another.

These messages are produced when copying duplicate files:

Across TDs: `Transferring unconditionally as --ignore-times is in use` (creates dupe)

Within My Drive: `don't need to copy/move <file>, it is already at target location` (no dupe)

Ideally these would behave the same. More importantly:

#### What am I trying to do?

Change the "creator" of all files in `td-dest:` -- a mirror of `td-source:` -- from a non-service account to a set of service accounts, on a schedule.

I'm able to achieve this (very inefficiently) using a script that:

- Takes input from `rclone lsjson -R td-source:`
- Creates server side copies using concurrent `copyto` commands, thus changing the "creator."

  - E.g.: `rclone copyto td-source:path/to/file td-dest:path/to/file --drive-service-account-file /path/to/service.json --ignore-times`

- Removes the old files using `rclone dedupe --dedupe-mode newest td-dest:`

What I would prefer to do is just overwrite the files on `td-dest:` in one go.

If this is possible, it might make sense for the `--no-traverse` flag to enable this behavior.

Should I create a separate feature request for this?

#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)

    rclone v1.46.0-103-g8d29d69a-beta
    - os/arch: linux/amd64
    - go version: go1.12.1

#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)

Debian 9 x64

#### Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)

Google Drive

#### The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

Team drives

    rclone -vvv --log-file ~/Documents/rclone_issue_tds.log touch td-source-test:foo >>~/Documents/rclone_issue_tds.log
    rclone -vvv --log-file ~/Documents/rclone_issue_tds.log touch td-dest-test:foo >>~/Documents/rclone_issue_tds.log
    rclone -vvv --log-file ~/Documents/rclone_issue_tds.log lsl td-source-test: >>~/Documents/rclone_issue_tds.log
    rclone -vvv --log-file ~/Documents/rclone_issue_tds.log lsl td-dest-test: >>~/Documents/rclone_issue_tds.log
    rclone -vvv --log-file ~/Documents/rclone_issue_tds.log copyto td-source-test:foo td-dest-test:foo --ignore-times >>~/Documents/rclone_issue_tds.log
    rclone -vvv --log-file ~/Documents/rclone_issue_tds.log lsl td-dest-test: >>~/Documents/rclone_issue_tds.log
    rclone -vvv --log-file ~/Documents/rclone_issue_tds.log copyto td-source-test:foo td-dest-test:foo --ignore-times >>~/Documents/rclone_issue_tds.log
    rclone -vvv --log-file ~/Documents/rclone_issue_tds.log lsl td-dest-test: >>~/Documents/rclone_issue_tds.log
    rclone -vvv --log-file ~/Documents/rclone_issue_tds.log copyto td-source-test:foo td-dest-test:foo --ignore-times >>~/Documents/rclone_issue_tds.log
    rclone -vvv --log-file ~/Documents/rclone_issue_tds.log lsl td-dest-test: >>~/Documents/rclone_issue_tds.log

My Drive

    rclone -vvv --log-file ~/Documents/rclone_issue_mydrive.log touch mydrive:foo >>~/Documents/rclone_issue_mydrive.log
    rclone -vvv --log-file ~/Documents/rclone_issue_mydrive.log touch mydrive:foo >>~/Documents/rclone_issue_mydrive.log
    rclone -vvv --log-file ~/Documents/rclone_issue_mydrive.log lsl mydrive: >>~/Documents/rclone_issue_mydrive.log
    rclone -vvv --log-file ~/Documents/rclone_issue_mydrive.log lsl mydrive: >>~/Documents/rclone_issue_mydrive.log
    rclone -vvv --log-file ~/Documents/rclone_issue_mydrive.log copyto mydrive:foo mydrive:foo --ignore-times >>~/Documents/rclone_issue_mydrive.log
    rclone -vvv --log-file ~/Documents/rclone_issue_mydrive.log lsl mydrive: >>~/Documents/rclone_issue_mydrive.log
    rclone -vvv --log-file ~/Documents/rclone_issue_mydrive.log copyto mydrive:foo mydrive:foo --ignore-times >>~/Documents/rclone_issue_mydrive.log
    rclone -vvv --log-file ~/Documents/rclone_issue_mydrive.log lsl mydrive: >>~/Documents/rclone_issue_mydrive.log
    rclone -vvv --log-file ~/Documents/rclone_issue_mydrive.log copyto mydrive:foo mydrive:foo --ignore-times >>~/Documents/rclone_issue_mydrive.log
    rclone -vvv --log-file ~/Documents/rclone_issue_mydrive.log lsl mydrive: >>~/Documents/rclone_issue_mydrive.log
